Description: Rim and wall fragment of pottery cup; lip slightly everted and thickened. Glazed black on the interior and on lip outside; in the handle zone, remains of two dancing or otherwise cavorting males in silhouette.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Egyptian Museum, Cairo. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Venit: 'The figures rendered in silhouette are unusual; the style of drawing supports a date in the fifth century or later.'
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 55, no. 192, pl. 45)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.240)
